intro: Campanula cochleariifolia subsp. reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This subspecies is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
